text:
Had free flight lessons on the DA-40CS during my time here back in poly. Good memories and friends were made here.

Instructors are ex-RSAF so they'll give you a taste of how they teach stuff in the air force. One tip I have is to lower your instructor's headset volume before taking off.

Being a government-linked organisation means it has to adhere to a budget like the SAF and civil service. Which you can see with their old computers that they use for teaching and barely-functioning aircon in the planes. "If it ain't broke don't fix it" is manifested in the equipment and infrastructure of the club.

Not that it's a bad thing though. As a student you just need to pay for 2 polo t-shirts and a booklet. The rest is free!
There was one guy that took a picture of me and my friend and thinks that we doesnâ€™t know and after I confronted him and he deleted the pic
The Singapore Youth Flying Club premises.  A purpose-built facility providing free flight training and aviation-related activities for school-going youths.
We would like to thank Mr Wilson, Mr Rufus and Ms Alison for a wonderful learning journey at SYFC for my college students!
This is the ultimate CCA experience in Singapore for students in secondary school. Learning to fly for next to nothing is really cool.
